comprehensive_overview: libreadline is a GNU library that provides line-editing capabilities for interactive programs with a command-line interface. It allows users to edit text as they type commands, providing features such as history, editing, and completion of input.
core_features: History: Keeps track of previously entered commands, allowing users to navigate and reuse them easily.
Editing: Supports editing functionalities like cursor movement, deletion, and insertion within the input line.
Completion: Offers tab-completion for commands, variables, and file paths to assist users with input.
Customization: Allows for customization of key bindings, behavior, and appearance of the editing interface.
